greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Smallest k >= 0 such that 7^k has exactly n 0's in its decimal representation.
mathematica: a = {}; Do[k = 0; While[ Count[ IntegerDigits[7^k], 0] != n, k++ ]; a = Append[a, k], {n, 0, 50} ]; a
program: (PARI) A063606(n)=for(k=n, oo, #select(d->!d, digits(5^k))==n&&return(k)) \\ _M. F. Hasler_, Jun 14 2018
xref: Cf. A031146 (analog for 2^k), A063555 (analog for 3^k), A063575 (analog for 4^k), A063585 (for 5^k), A063596 (analog for 6^k).
results.author: _Robert G. Wilson v_, Aug 10 2001
